issue.title: Double istio rev in configmap name
issue.body:
Hello.

istio installed via helm

```
  values:
    revision: "1-18-0"
```

kiali

```
  values:
    allowAdHocKialiImage: true
    resources:
      limits:
        cpu: 1
    cr:
      create: true
      namespace: istio-system
      spec:
        istio_namespace: istio-system
        external_services:
          istio:
            config_map_name: "istio-1-18-0"
            istiod_deployment_name: "istiod-1-18-0"
            istio_sidecar_injector_config_map_name: "istio-sidecar-injector-1-18-0"
```

i receive this error from kiali log.

`ERR Error getting mesh config: configmap "istio-1-18-0-1-18-0" not found`

i do not understand why rev is doubled in configmap name?

Backport of #6755 to version 1.73. There are more changes than in referenced PR because there are previous PRs modifying this file that have not been backported. For this reason I have pushed the latest version of the hack script into v1.73.

**Issue reference**

Closes #6750

issue.title: need ossmconsole CRD even for non-openshift environs
issue.body:
This is happening in master builds - not affecting any releases (yet - it will affect the next release when the operator handles ossmc installs).

I was hoping we did not have to install the OSSMConsole CRD on non-OpenShift environments, but right now there isn't a way. The operator [watches.yaml declares to the operator it should watch for OSSMConsole CRs](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/blob/master/watches.yaml#L24-L35). So if the CRD does not exist (and it won't if you install the Operator using OLM - [the upstream OLM metadata doesn't include the CRD](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/blob/master/manifests/kiali-upstream/1.76.0/manifests/kiali.v1.76.0.clusterserviceversion.yaml#L136-L138) - only [the Kiali CRD exists](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/tree/master/manifests/kiali-upstream/1.76.0/manifests)) then this error will occur and the operator exits:

```
{"level":"error","ts":"2023-10-26T23:57:33Z","logger":"controller-runtime.source","msg":
"if kind is a CRD, it should be installed before calling Start","kind":"OSSMConsole.kiali.io",
"error":"no matches for kind \"OSSMConsole\" in version \"kiali.io/v1alpha1\"","stacktrace":
...
{"level":"error","ts":"2023-10-27T00:05:14Z","logger":"cmd","msg":"Proxy or operator exited with error.","Namespace":"","error":"failed to wait for ossmconsole-controller caches to sync: timed out waiting for cache to be synced"
...
```

We need to add the CRD to the upstream metadata so this error is avoided. The [operator helm chart includes this OSSMConsole CRD](https://github.com/kiali/helm-charts/blob/master/kiali-operator/crds/crds.yaml#L26-L47) already, so that isn't an issue when helm installed

In the future it would be nice to not have the operator require this CRD to be installed on non-OpenShift environments, but I don't know how to make the watches.yaml declare to the operator that it is OPTIONAL.

comment.body:
These are the replication steps that I used to see the issue.

1. Start up minikube (you don't need Istio for this test). You can do this via the hack scripts:
```
hack/k8s-minikube.sh start
```
3. Use this one command to (1) install OLM into the cluster, (2) build the operator image, (3) push the operator image into the cluster, and (4) deploy the operator via OLM:
```
make -e CLUSTER_TYPE=minikube -e OLM_BUNDLE_PACKAGE=kiali -e OC=$(which kubectl) olm-install cluster-push-operator olm-operator-create
```
4.  Eventually the error appears and the operator will stop.

issue.title: need ossmconsole CRD even for non-openshift environs
issue.body:
This is happening in master builds - not affecting any releases (yet - it will affect the next release when the operator handles ossmc installs).

I was hoping we did not have to install the OSSMConsole CRD on non-OpenShift environments, but right now there isn't a way. The operator [watches.yaml declares to the operator it should watch for OSSMConsole CRs](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/blob/master/watches.yaml#L24-L35). So if the CRD does not exist (and it won't if you install the Operator using OLM - [the upstream OLM metadata doesn't include the CRD](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/blob/master/manifests/kiali-upstream/1.76.0/manifests/kiali.v1.76.0.clusterserviceversion.yaml#L136-L138) - only [the Kiali CRD exists](https://github.com/kiali/kiali-operator/tree/master/manifests/kiali-upstream/1.76.0/manifests)) then this error will occur and the operator exits:

```
{"level":"error","ts":"2023-10-26T23:57:33Z","logger":"controller-runtime.source","msg":
"if kind is a CRD, it should be installed before calling Start","kind":"OSSMConsole.kiali.io",
"error":"no matches for kind \"OSSMConsole\" in version \"kiali.io/v1alpha1\"","stacktrace":
...
{"level":"error","ts":"2023-10-27T00:05:14Z","logger":"cmd","msg":"Proxy or operator exited with error.","Namespace":"","error":"failed to wait for ossmconsole-controller caches to sync: timed out waiting for cache to be synced"
...
```

We need to add the CRD to the upstream metadata so this error is avoided. The [operator helm chart includes this OSSMConsole CRD](https://github.com/kiali/helm-charts/blob/master/kiali-operator/crds/crds.yaml#L26-L47) already, so that isn't an issue when helm installed

In the future it would be nice to not have the operator require this CRD to be installed on non-OpenShift environments, but I don't know how to make the watches.yaml declare to the operator that it is OPTIONAL.

commits.message:
Make sure mesh_check appender only tries to check nodes in accessible namespaces (#6782)

- make accessible namespace check cluster-sensitive, otherwise the fetch of workload information will fail.
- add some type-safety and avoid de-decentralized key-string construction
- Fix tests
  - update some incorrectly defined AccessibleNamespace structures
  - ensure config properly defines cluster

https://github.com/kiali/kiali/issues/6772

issue.title: Fix double revision in istio configmap name
issue.body:
Uses: `conf.ExternalServices.Istio.ConfigMapName` without adding the rev tag when it is set and not the default `istio`.

Fixes #6669

comment.body: probably removing the logic to append the revision all together would be a more cohesive solution.  I think we can simply expect users to provide the correct values through `external_services.istio`

Fixes #6669

comment.body: good to see this get merged, what's the ETA for new helm chart release? thanks for the hard work!

issue.title: Double istio rev in configmap name
issue.body:
Hello.

istio installed via helm

```
  values:
    revision: "1-18-0"
```

kiali

```
  values:
    allowAdHocKialiImage: true
    resources:
      limits:
        cpu: 1
    cr:
      create: true
      namespace: istio-system
      spec:
        istio_namespace: istio-system
        external_services:
          istio:
            config_map_name: "istio-1-18-0"
            istiod_deployment_name: "istiod-1-18-0"
            istio_sidecar_injector_config_map_name: "istio-sidecar-injector-1-18-0"
```

i receive this error from kiali log.

`ERR Error getting mesh config: configmap "istio-1-18-0-1-18-0" not found`

i do not understand why rev is doubled in configmap name?

comment.body:
> Also would like to understand what issue it causes on the Kiali side (if any) ?

@aleksandermiszkiewicz from what I can tell, the only thing that was affected by this issue was validations for Gateways. If you were using `PILOT_SCOPE_GATEWAY_TO_NAMESPACE = true`, then you might have gotten a false negative (validation passed when it should've failed) if your `Gateway` selected a workload outside of the Gateway's namespace.

review.body: i approve, however, the code can be simplified IMO by extracting out those Sprintfs into a single common utility so that future devs dont' have to worry about building the correct formatted string.

comment.body:
alarm bells go off when I see the same Sprintf everywhere building some formatted string (cluster, followed by colon, followed by namespace).

Consider creating a common utility function that everyone uses so you don't have these Sprintfs all over the place (especially if in the future that syntax needs to change for some reason).

istio installed via helm

kiali

pull_request.title: Fix double revision in istio configmap name
pull_request.body:
Uses: `conf.ExternalServices.Istio.ConfigMapName` without adding the rev tag when it is set and not the default `istio`.

Fixes #6669

repo.name: kiali
repo.description: Kiali project, observability for the Istio service mesh

repo.name: kiali
repo.description: Kiali project, observability for the Istio service mesh

issue.title: Fix double revision in istio configmap name
issue.body:
Uses: `conf.ExternalServices.Istio.ConfigMapName` without adding the rev tag when it is set and not the default `istio`.

Fixes #6669

comment.body:
> I have a feeling our support for canary upgrades still isn't seamless but we can worry about that later.

Yes this change doesn't make the support for canary upgrades any better but it at least gets rid of the error log when you've set `config.external_services.istio.config_map_name`.

Because basically this is the only place that is handling there being multiple controlplanes. Everywhere else just assumes there's one. When set `config.external_services.istio.config_map_name`, `IstioConfigMapName` will always return what you've set there regardless of what revision you pass in. It's a bit of a hack to get around the fact that, right now we expect users to set this manually when using control plane revisions.

issue.title: Unable to reach API Server 'istio APIs and resources are not present in cluster [Kubernetes]'
issue.body:
## versions
- istio `1.18.2`
- kiali-server `1.73.0`
- k8s `1.28.1`

## Problem
The Kiali dashboard on the console wasn't loading and the pod logs were the following.
```
kiali {"level":"info","time":"2023-09-09T13:08:46Z","message":"Adding a RegistryRefreshHandler"}
kiali 2023-09-09T13:08:46Z INF Kiali: Version: v1.73.0, Commit: 2e54c9e768905ad47338a1641c6777c3f2fbcc9c, Go: 1.20.5
kiali 2023-09-09T13:08:46Z WRN Cannot resolve local cluster name. Err: Get "https://172.16.16.1:443/apis/apps/v1/namespaces/istio-system/deployments/istiod": dial tcp 172.16.16.1:443: connect: connection refused. Falling back to [Kubernetes]
kiali 2023-09-09T13:08:46Z INF Using authentication strategy [token]
kiali 2023-09-09T13:08:46Z INF Some validation errors will be ignored [KIA1301]. If these errors do occur, they will still be logged. If you think the validation errors you see are incorrect, please report them to the Kiali team if you have not done so already and provide the details of your scenario. This will keep Kiali validations strong for the whole community.

kiali     /opt/hostedtoolcache/go/1.20.5/x64/src/net/http/server.go:1995 +0x612
kiali created by net/http.(*Server).Serve
kiali     /opt/hostedtoolcache/go/1.20.5/x64/src/net/http/server.go:3089 +0x5ed
kiali 
```
After troubleshooting turned out the issue was simply the istio sidecar coming online before the main `kiali-server` container.

## Temporary Solution
Adding a wait annotation for the sidecar to become available. 
```yaml
deployment:
  pod_annotations:
    proxy.istio.io/config: '{ "holdApplicationUntilProxyStarts": true }'
```
## Suggested Long Term Solution
Maybe there should be retries and timeouts added.

issue.title: empty tree entry in kiali.io installation menu and goes to incorrect place
issue.body:
This maistra compat table is included in the prerequisites page, but for some reason it also shows up as its own page with an empty left hand tree item. We should get rid of that.

```
$ pwd
/home/jmazzite/source/kiali/kiali.io/content/en/docs/Installation/installation-guide
$ grep compatibility-maistra *
prerequisites.md:{{% readfile file="/content/en/docs/Installation/installation-guide/compatibility-maistra.md" %}}
```

![image](https://github.com/kiali/kiali/assets/2029470/48c0995e-38ee-4426-9f29-fe7a6eed85a4)

issue.title: initial docs for ossmc need to be in kiali.io
issue.body: need to move [these ossmc docs](https://github.com/kiali/openshift-servicemesh-plugin/tree/main/docs) into kiali.io

review.body: this does the refactor so everywhere in the code gets the configmap name using the common function. I have a feeling our support for canary upgrades still isn't seamless but we can worry about that later.

pull_request.title: Fix double revision in istio configmap name
pull_request.body:
Uses: `conf.ExternalServices.Istio.ConfigMapName` without adding the rev tag when it is set and not the default `istio`.

Fixes #6669

repo.name: kiali
repo.description: Kiali project, observability for the Istio service mesh

repo.name: kiali
repo.description: Kiali project, observability for the Istio service mesh

issue.title: Do we have plan to support for international languages，especially kiali_ui?

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is the preferred way to describe new end-to-end features.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Needs a contributor. Useful but outside maintainer backlog

comment.body: Hi @dannyxu2015 , Well that is interesting :-)   I expect this would be a large effort.  If you are considering offering this effort to the project then I'd recommend letting us know more details about the approach and design, and working with us to ensure it would be a feasible addition.  Of course, if your effort is fork then you are free to do what you need!  It's cool that you like Kiali enough to try and make it available to native Chinese users.

pull_request.title: Fix double revision in istio configmap name
pull_request.body:
Uses: `conf.ExternalServices.Istio.ConfigMapName` without adding the rev tag when it is set and not the default `istio`.

Fixes #6669
